task.title: Deleting an appliance user by using the command line
task.shortdesc: System administrators can delete appliance users by using the user delete command on the command line.

taskbody.context: You can delete an appliance user by using the command line, or by using the . For more information about using the to delete an appliance user, see .

step.cmd: To delete an appliance user, enter the following command:
step.info:
The command must be capitalized as shown.
user delete "UserID=UserID" "Type=WebUI"Where:
UserID Specifies the user ID of the appliance user to delete.

taskbody.example: The following example shows deleting the appliance user TEST: user delete "UserID=TEST" "Type=WebUI" The requested configuration change has completed successfully.
